id: ECD Emotional Change Strategy Practitioner Course - Central Wellington - 11th September-Level, 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: ECD Emotional Change Strategy Practitioner Course - Central Wellington - 11th September
venue: Level, 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
ECD Emotional Strategy Development 1 Day Certification Course

Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Change Practitioner
Apply The ECD to manage change effectively by harnessing the collective emotions of your people and teams.
This course is essential for change leaders and managers looking to focus on navigating the emotional side of change within their organisations. The Emotional Change Strategy Course equips participants with the tools and knowledge to better lead and land change with empathy, compassion, and emotional intelligence. The course is designed to be highly interactive and hands-on, allowing leaders to practice and apply what they learn in a tactile learning environment.
This hands-on 1 day workshop is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Change Tools
Exploration of personal and team responses to change.
Development of effective, co-creative change strategies.
Understanding the power of rituals in managing change.
“Change is emotional. It is the heart, not the mind, that accepts change. Emotions matter more than models of change; we must seek to understand the emotions of the people within those models..Today is all about play and learning by doing! So before I tell you more, let’s play.” - Jeremy Dean (founder Riders & Elephants and creator of the ECD)

What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Change Strategy Course and unlock a wealth of resources:
ECD Emotional Change Toolkit - Valued at $330 NZD: Get this toolkit, filled with a selection of physical and online resources tailored for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature is designed to extend your learning and application of the course content.
Your Own Emotional Culture Deck - Valued at $160 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying course principles in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on your future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck, a testament to our commitment to your ongoing development.
ECD Emotional Change Strategy Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain 90 days of access to online ECD resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to Change Strategy development

Your Emotional Change Toolkit:
As part of the Course, you gain access to a change toolkit, designed to enrich your learning and application of change mastery. Here's what's included, providing you with comprehensive resources valued at a total of 330 NZD:
ECD Personal Change Conversation Guide: Facilitate meaningful conversations around personal change, empowering you and your team to navigate transitions with greater awareness and alignment.
ECD Know Yourself Through Change Handbook: A reflective tool that guides you in understanding your own responses to change, fostering personal growth and resilience.
ECD Change Leadership Canvas & Workshop Plan: Strategise and execute change leadership with a structured approach, enhancing your ability to lead effectively during transitional times.
ECD Exploring Team Change Canvas & Workshop Plan: Collaboratively explore and address team dynamics during change, fostering a supportive and adaptive team environment.
ECD Change Rituals Canvas: Introduce and establish meaningful rituals that support and acknowledge change processes, reinforcing a culture of continuous adaptation and cohesion.
Bonus: ECD Transitions Handbook: Dive deeper into managing transitions with this additional resource, offering further strategies and insights to complement your change toolkit.
These resources are not just theoretical; they're practical, actionable tools that you will learn to apply during the course, ensuring you can implement what you've learned immediately and effectively within your teams or consulting practices.
Is The ECD Emotional Change Strategy Course Right for You?
This Course is carefully designed not only for in-house change leaders but also for external change agents who are passionate about driving meaningful progress. It is ideal for:
Change Managers: Who are looking for innovative ways to lead transformation initiatives with empathy and insight.
Organisation Development Managers: Who aim to shape adaptable, resilient organisational cultures.
HR Professionals: Who support and guide employees through the human aspects of organisational changes.
Coaches and Consultants: Who help organisations navigate through change with bespoke solutions.
Project Leaders: Who oversee transitions and want to ensure they are carried out with emotional intelligence.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Who manage day-to-day team dynamics and want to lead with a deeper understanding of emotional drivers.
Strategic Planners: Involved in crafting the long-term direction of their organisations and understanding the emotional implications of change.
Whether you're guiding a team internally or advising organisations externally, the Emotional Change Strategy Course will equip you with the ECD tools and skills to facilitate change with empathy and humanity.
Your ECD journey towards starts here.
As soon as you successfully complete your Course, you qualify as a certified ECD Change Practitioner and proudly earn your Elephant Rider Badge. This marks your commitment to crafting emotional cultures and connects you with our global community, The Emotional Culture Community, ready to support your growth.
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck as part of navigating and managing change 
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 490 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

Tuesday 11th September 2025 
9:00 AM – 4:30 PM NZST
Location

15 Willeston Street

Wellington 6011
New Zealand

id: Developing your Solution Focused Approach, NZCCA Wellington PD Day-106 Mana Esplanade, Paremata, Wellington 5026, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Developing your Solution Focused Approach, NZCCA Wellington PD Day
venue: 106 Mana Esplanade, Paremata, Wellington 5026, New Zealand
description:
The Solution Focused Approach is currently a leading method in leadership, coaching, education, and counselling throughout the world. The principles of the Solution Focused approach are simple to understand and easily mastered with practice - it has been likened to learning a language. From this workshop, people will gain skills and knowledge that can be immediately applied to their context or environment. At the heart of Solution focused practice is the belief that change is possible in people’s lives, and change is happening all the time. When a client is asked to notice change it amplifies it makes a difference to the client. It is a great pleasure and honour to walk with clients during this process.
 In the Solution Focused workshop, you will:
+ Learn the art or be refreshed in the Solution Focused approach
+ Develop a Solution Focused mindset to ask questions with hope
+ Draw on the wealth of Bible resources for hope
+ Apply with particular attention to people living with Grief and Loss, Trauma and Couples (my favourite issues)
+ Apply questions to help others find confidence, resources and move forward
+ Focus on solutions rather than the problem/s
+ Practice the skills needed to apply the Solution Focused approach
+ Share your strengths and resources in a Solution Focused way
+ Facilitate a Solution Focused conversation with individuals or groups
+ Hear some of the latest developments in the Solution Focused world
+ Have opportunities to ask questions and discuss with others
 Come on a hope-filled journey of change, joy, and possibility. 
1/2 price for students!
  Bio
Matt Cameron lives in Timaru, NZ and is a counsellor, Solution Focused trainer, teacher, and tennis referee. He also enjoys being a home handyman, building or fixing things. His Christian faith is important to him and he serves on a leadership team in his church. A NZCCA member, he also leads the Online Region. He has been married to his beautiful wife for 25 years and they have two boys in their early 20's. He enjoys various sports and has played competitive tennis, badminton, soccer, rugby and most recently fistball - being selected to play in the NZ Masters team (google "fistball" if you haven’t heard of it!).

id: Pōneke Leader Learning & Doing Day (Sep 2025)-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix

venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Often, the best folk to learn from (and commiserate with) are other leaders. But since we're so busy in the doing, we don't often have the time or ability to take a full day off from work to dedicate to learning new things.... and sometimes conferences can be hit and miss on content.
Last year we created a Leader Learning & Doing Day, where you can come and co-work in the same space as a bunch of other founders and leaders, and also go to mini unconference sessions during the day that are set by you. You share/learn/discuss the things that matter to you most - with other folk that are going through it. We had sessions ranging from how to use AI in your org, founder transitions, and even a photographer taking new head shots for folk. 
The price of the ticket covers a koha to the venue and for some coffee/snacks. You can choose to come to all the sessions, or just one or two of them, and you'll have access to coffee and wifi throughout the day. 

Below is our plan for the day:
9:30am - Arrival & coffee
9:45am - Welcome, Introduction round & Agenda Setting
10:30am - Session 1
11:30am - Session 2
12:30pm - Lunch
1:30pm - Session 3
2:30pm - Farewell/head out for a drink (or home - you choose!)
Co-hosts
Anna Guenther - helps Kiwi fund the things they care about. Co-founder of PledgeMe and Cheese Cartel, co-instigator of Women Who Get Sh*t Done Unconference
Ash Holwell -  creates spaces enabling care and connection towards a socially and sustainably just world. Co-founder of oneonesix, oneonethree and two/fiftyseven they believe deeply that safe places are fundamental to thriving communities, therefore everyone should have access to them.

name: The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 5th & 6th August 2025

description:
1 or 2 Day Workshop in Wellington
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for? 
Leaders, emerging leaders, professionals who need to create a significant shift in their communication skills, or confident communicators looking to become compelling communicators! 

The ability to inspire and influence, win new business and gain respect from audiences, are essential skills for business leaders everywhere. Presentation training has never been more important.
In this two day course you will learn how to become a more confident, engaging and influential presenter. 
What you will learn:
Day One:
Create Engaging Content: Learn how to use the Effective Speaking SpeakerMap™ to quickly create an engaging presentation that your audience will value.
Design Useful Visuals: Discover the alternatives to “death by bullet-point” and transform your slides to engaging and useful visual content.
Manage your Nervousness: Learn how to manage your feelings of nervousness and stage-fright.
Day Two:
Preparation that makes a difference: Learn how to prepare for your presentation so you feel and sound more confident and relaxed.
Deliver with Impact: Speak to a group with the confidence and ease with which you speak when you’re communicating one-on-one.
Handle that Audience: Learn how to handle any curve-balls the audience throws you!
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation
"After reading many books it was great to finally learn an effective and no fuss way of creating a presentation that looks professional and won't put the client to sleep. I can see how the SpeakerMap will be a valuable tool for creating my trainings and presentations in the future. Thanks for the opportunity to present, the feedback I received was really valuable." Shannan Clarke - Business Development Leader - Front-Line Training
“Out of the 117 presenters that spoke at the TechEd conference my final ranking was #9. I absolutely would not have achieved that had it not been for the invaluable speaker training you provided! Thank you so much.” Daniel Bowbyes, Information Architect, Datacom
Choose your package:
Preparation Day Only - 1 day only
Have you got limited time or budget? Then this option may be for you. Come along on the Preparation Day and you will learn the foundation skills behind being an engaging and confident presenter.
You will learn :
How to use the Effective Speaking SpeakerMap™ to quickly create an engaging presentation. This system has helped thousands of New Zealanders learn how to prepare credible, valuable and effective business presentations.
Discover the alternatives to “death by bullet-point” and transform your slides to engaging visual content
Learn how to manage your feelings of nervousness and stage-fright
70-page manual – “How to design and deliver a presentation with confidence”
Cost: $995 +GST
Observer Place - 2 days
Are you very nervous about presenting and not quite ready for front of the room coaching? Then this option is for you. Attend both days, and learn how to design your presentation, design engaging PowerPoint slides, manage your nerves and how to prepare. However when it comes to the Delivery - you won't have to get up and present to the group.
You will learn:
How to use the Effective Speaking SpeakerMap™ to quickly create an engaging presentation. This system has helped thousands of New Zealanders learn how to prepare credible, valuable and effective business presentations.
Discover the alternatives to “death by bullet-point” and transform your slides to engaging visual content
Learn how to manage your feelings of nervousness and stage-fright
Practicing the delivery techniques you learn in groups of 2s & 3s
Seeing and learning through the improvements others make in their coaching sessions
Analyzing the techniques been taught and giving feedback to the presenters
70-page manual – “How to design and deliver a presentation with confidence”
On-going “as-you-need-it” advice by email and telephone
Cost: $1,995 + GST
Presenter Place - 2 Day. Our most popular option
Are you looking to create a real shift in your ability to present and learn lasting skills that will take your presentations to the next level? Then this course is for you. 
You will learn:
How to use the Effective Speaking SpeakerMap™ to quickly create an engaging presentation. This system has helped thousands of New Zealanders learn how to prepare credible, valuable and effective business presentations.
Discover the alternatives to “death by bullet-point” and transform your slides to engaging visual content
Learn how to manage your feelings of nervousness and stage-fright

id: FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025 WELLINGTON- TUESDAY 16TH SEPTEMBER-34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025 WELLINGTON- TUESDAY 16TH SEPTEMBER
venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025
The Futuna Lecture Series commenced in 2011 and has been one of the main annual events on the NZ Architectural calendar for the last 14 years. It is the Futuna Chapel Trust’s major fundraiser each year and attracts a large audience of architects, architectural designers, technicians, architecture and design students and interested members of the public. The Trust exists solely on koha/donations as well as financial support from selected sponsors and donors.
Our sponsors, Dulux NZ, APL, Plytech, Warren Trust and the Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington NZIA branches have continued their support for the Futuna Lecture Series 2025.
This year the Trust welcomes three new sponsors being Roofing Industries Limited, AGP and Big River Panels. The additional support of these new sponsors is very much appreciated and ensures that the Futuna Chapel Trust can continue to attract speakers to NZ of a similar calibre to that of the 2025 Futuna Lecture, Francis Kéré.
The Trust takes this opportunity to thank Metalcraft Roofing for their support of the Futuna Lecture Series from 2012 - 2024.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work and well as that of the Kéré Foundation.
The Trust will donate 20% of the ticket income to the Kéré Foundation to support the work of Francis Kéré in Gando, Burkina Faso.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all funds raised from the Futuna Lecture Series go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.  Please register using the ticket types of $10, $15, $25 or $30 GST inclusive.  Booking fees are in addition to the ticket prices.
BOOKINGS ARE ESSENTIAL TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
There will be 15 Design CPD points available for NZ registered architects attending the event. Please include your NZRAB registration number when purchasing Architect tickets

description:
Costuming Austen's Characters (Rescheduled May Event)
Following on from our panel discussion with the writers and directors of local Austen productions we welcome costumier Meredith Dooley who worked on dressing the actors for all those productions.
Meredith Dooley is a Wellington born and bred actor, director and costumier. She completed a BA in Theatre and Film at Victoria University of Wellington in the early 1990s, and then trained in acting and directing in London. In 2018-19 she gained a Diploma in Costume Construction at Toi Whakaari New Zealand Drama School and spent the next two Covid-affected years working on theatre, film and television productions such as Wellington Paranormal, Mr Corman, WOW, and Wellington Opera's Don Giovanni.
Meredith has returned to the office and over the last few years has created costumes for Stagecraft's Pride & Prejudice and Persuasion, and KAT Theatre's Sense and Sensibility, amongst others. Early in 2024 she dipped her toes back into professional theatre, working with cabaret star Meow Meow during the NZ Festival of the Arts.

id: After Austen: Em-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: After Austen: Em
venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
We are so excited to welcome award-winning playwright Sam Brooks, to discuss his play Em, a queer retelling of Jane Austen’s masterwork Emma, turned around, flipped and set in our very own Queenstown.
Emmett Woodhouse, handsome, clever and rich, with a comfortable home and a gay disposition has lived nearly [redacted] years in the world with very little to distress or vex him.

Until now.
Em won the Dean Parker Adaptation Award at the 2023 Adam New Zealand Play Awards.
Attendees get an exclusive 10% discount at Unity Books
Bring a friend: purchase 2 or more tickets and get a 10% discount
Sam Brooks is an award-winning and prolific playwright and journalist, who is largely noted for his critically acclaimed LGBTQ+ work, including Riding in Cars with (Mostly Straight) Boys, Queen, and most recently This is My Story of Us, which was co-winner of the 2024 Adam New Zealand Play Award. He won the Bruce Mason Playwright's Award, New Zealand's most prestigious award for playwrights. In 2018 his political work, Burn Her, was performed as part of Q's Matchbox Season and won the Auckland Theatre Excellence Award for Best Overall Production. He has been shortlisted multiple years for the Adam New Zealand Play Award, and won the Dean Parker award in 2023.
As a journalist, he has written for The Spinoff and has had bylines at the Pantrograph Punch, Metro and the NZ Herald.
Who this event is for:
People who love Austen
People who love the theatre
Fans of Sam's work
Writers
Actors
Directors
Afternoon tea provided
(If you have issues paying via credit card you can pay via invoice or contact us - this should be fixed now)
FAQs
Do I need to know about Jane Austen?
No. Everyone is welcome.
Do I need to see the play first?
It hasn't been staged (yet) so I'd be surprised if you had!
Do I need to be a member of the society?
We don't technically have membership, if you turn up we think of you as a member.
I have accessibility or dietary requirements
We aim to meet at venues that are accessible and provide for all dietary requirements. Please check out the accessibility section or contact us if you're unsure. We want you to be there and we want you to be comfortable.
What are the meetings like?
We meet at two/fiftyseven which is accessed via lift. There is a talk, a break with afternoon tea, then we come back together for questions. You can choose to engage with others, or not. We're happy to assign you a buddy for your first meeting too.

TEDxYouthPaparangi aims to amplify the voices of young people in the community. Attend our event for an evening of eye-opening speeches, incredible performances, and a chance to network and meet new people! 
Our theme, “The Power of Now” is not just an expression, it’s a call to action. A reminder that the present moment is the key to change, innovation, and progress. Too often, we wait for the “right time,” or dwell on the past, but why not now? “The Power of Now” challenges us to embrace the unknown, take bold steps, and seize every opportunity possible. Whether it’s through personal growth, societal change, or innovative thinking, “The Power of Now” is about harnessing the energy of today to shape a better tomorrow.

id: The Pipeline of Potential: A welfare-to-work policy report-157 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix

venue: 157 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The Institute for Democratic and Economic Analysis (IDEA) invites you to attend the launch of its first research project: a deep dive into welfare-to-work policy at a light breakfast event on Thursday 24th July.
The Pipeline of Potential report looks at how we could transform the support we offer to unemployed people seeking paid work, simultaneously lifting their prospects and boosting the wider economy. Join us to hear IDEA research director Max Rashbrooke opening up new perspectives on a long neglected policy area. His recommendations outline investments in training and work programmes that could change lives and constitute a key building block for a more robust economy.
Please RSVP for this free event by clicking on "Get tickets". You are welcome to register more than one person.

venue: 56 The Terrace, Wellington Central, Wellington 6140, New Zealand
description:
Come along to the launch of ‘Whaimana - Support My Decisions’
When: 11am-12:30pm, 24 July 2025
Where: Online via MS Teams or in person at 56 The Terrace, Aurora Centre, Wellington Central.
Whaimana - Support My Decisions is a website about Supported Decision Making. Supported decision-making helps people make their own choices about their lives, with the support of the people that they choose.
The website has helpful information for:
·       people making choices and decisions (decision-makers)
·       family, whānau, and friends who want to support people
·       paid supporters working for disabled people or older persons with reduced capacity
·       supporters who have may hold legal roles such as EPOA (Enduring Power of Attorney), Welfare Guardian or Property Manager
·       advocates (people who speak up for others).
The launch of Whaimana – Support My Decisions will be celebrated with Hon. Louise Upston, Minister for Disability Issues, and Paula Tesoriero, CE of Whaikaha – Ministry of Disabled People, and advisory group members.
We will take a tour of the website, to show you information, resources, and links. This website was put together by  Whaikaha - Ministry of Disabled People and an advisory group made up of people with dementia, disabled people, tāngata whaikaha Māori, and family/whānau who worked along side non-government organisations, other government agencies,
NZSL interpreters and light catering will be provided.

id: Seeding hope-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Seeding hope
venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Dr Jessica Hutchings has been leading and researching Indigenous food systems for decades, working from Papawhakaritorito, the farm she shares with Jo Smith at Kaitoke.  Jo and Jessica teach hua parakore, a kaupapa Māori system and framework for growing Kai Atua (Māori organic kai) and in November 2024 they published the book Pātaka Kai, which celebrates abundant food communities throughout Aotearoa.   In October 2024, Jess and Jo led mana wahine to Vandana Shiva’s Navdanya centre in India to present a Mana Wāhine Declaration on Seed and Soil.
Jessica will talk about the three pillars of seed, soil sovereignty and kai sovereignty as key food food futures as well as what it means to be in right relationship with our soil, seed and food systems.

id: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference-4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference
venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Ara Ake, in partnership with Community Energy Network and WISE Charitable Trust, is pleased to present the third annual Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference — formerly the Reducing Energy Hardship Conference.
About the conference
This two-day event brings together around 200 attendees to explore the state of energy hardship in Aotearoa, highlight key innovations, and share insights from iwi, communities, and organisations leading change on the ground.
The conference provides a unique platform for thought leaders, practitioners, policy makers, and innovators to connect and collaborate on building a more equitable, affordable, and resilient energy system.
2025 Theme: Regional solutions for equitable energy
New Zealand’s energy future must reflect the diversity of our people, places, and priorities. As we face rising climate, infrastructure, and cost-of-living pressures, regional approaches are becoming key to improving energy resilience—our ability to respond to and recover from disruptions—and affordability, particularly in rural and remote communities.
This year’s conference will explore how regional projects, partnerships and innovations can unlock sustainable, community-led energy solutions and promote energy equity across the motu.
What to expect
The 2025 conference will:
Explore the current roles and relationships between regional and national actors in delivering energy resilience and affordability
Highlight successful initiatives, including iwi-led and community-driven models
Recommend pathways for policy, investment, and coordination to support leadership and scale local impact

id: Padel New Zealand Tour 2025 Registration - Wellington-48A Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Padel New Zealand Tour 2025 Registration - Wellington
venue: 48A Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
description:
Event description
Welcome to the inaugural Padel New Zealand Tour 2025, a nationwide series of tournaments designed to bring players of all levels together.
There will be three events in 2025 – starting off in Tauranga, then off to Wellington in the winter, and lastly Auckland in the summer—each offering the opportunity to earn official ranking points and showcase your skills.
Join us in Wellington July 18-20th
3 indoor double courts, 1 single (warm up) court
Hosted by Padel House NZ Address: 48A Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington
Registration - NOW CLOSED
Registration entry fee: $75 per player. Humanitix booking fees apply(100% of Humanitix booking fees donated to charity). 
Registration closes Tuesday July 8th at 9pm unless sold out prior. Limited spaces so be quick to not miss out!
Tournament Format
3-day event (Friday–Sunday)
Friday: Games commencing from mid-afternoon to evening - required to attend for all players.
Saturday & Sunday: Games from morning to evening - required to attend for all players.
Categories:
A Grade Men - 10 teams (FULL)
B Grade Men - 16 teams (FULL)
A Grade Women - 8 teams (FULL)
Update June 19th: due to low sign ups in Women's B-grade, this category will be cancelled. The B-grade Men category filled up early due to very high interest and had a waitlist so 4 additional team spots have been allocated to this category.
Maximum number across all 3 grades: 72 players/36 teams (due to size of venue and number of courts)
Match format:
Pool play 
Two sets, tiebreak if 1-1
Golden point (no deuce)
Players self referee. Players to call the score so officials and spectators can easily follow the game.
Matches under standard padel rules.
Minor variations are possible if court time is limited. 
Note: The format could vary some for different grades depending on number of total entries.
Full match format information will be provided prior and at tournament.
Schedule/Draws
The draws will be done by the hosting clubs through the Tour. Schedule and draws will be released at beginning of the week before the event commences (week commencing July 14th).
Player License
To play in national tournaments arranged by Padel New Zealand you will need a player license. Please note that all players for Wellington will need a new license for the new financial year starting July 1st, 2025 and valid to June 30th, 2026. All previous licenses purchased will expire June 30th 2025.
Please purchase the player license, ideally when you register for the tournament but at the latest before closing of tournament registrations July 8th 9pm.
The license fee is $25 per annum for the new financial year July 2025-June 2026. Credit card fees apply. 
Licenses are required by International padel standards for any tournament organised by a federation. They also help Padel New Zealand maintain accurate records of player participation, skill levels, and ranking points throughout the season.
More information on how to register for a license here: www.padelnewzealand.org.nz/player-license
Ranking Points
All Padel New Zealand’s tournaments will have Ranking Points.
Points will be awarded at each tournament based on match results.
Rankings will be updated on our socials(top 10) and website(full list) after each event.
Full details on how points are calculated and used can be found on the Padel New Zealand website
Frequently Asked Questions
1. Who can enter these tournaments?
Anyone with a valid Padel New Zealand player license is welcome, regardless of skill level or nationality.
2. I don’t have a partner—can I register?
Please find a partner before registering - you will need to enter as a team. Your local club may able to assist to find partners or try to contact other players in the various padel Whatsapp groups.
3. What is an approximate guide for the A and B grades?
A‐grade: For competitive players with stronger skills - strong upper intermediates to advanced levels.
B‐grade: Ideal for more more casual/social players - lower intermediate to mid-intermediate levels.
4. What equipment do I need?
A standard padel racket and non-marking shoes. HEAD padel balls are provided, and a limited number of demo rackets will be available to borrow at some venues.
5. How do match formats and scoring work?
Matches will be 2 sets and tie break if 1-1(first to 7). Golden Point - no deuce play. Pool tie breaker will be calculated on games won in pool play. Top 2 teams in each pool qualify for play offs.
Players self-referee but there will be access to an official from the club or Padel New Zealand to call in at disputes/queries. 
6. Are spectators allowed?
Friends and family are welcome to come along and support. There could be limited space in some venues of the Tour. Each venue will have its own food and beverage options. 
If you have any questions about this tournament, please contact Padel New Zealand

id: NAWIC Wellington Site Visit: Whakawhirinaki – The Silverstream Pipe Bridge-Access to Hutt River Cycle Trail Eastern Hutt Road, Silverstream, Upper Hutt 5019, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: NAWIC Wellington Site Visit: Whakawhirinaki – The Silverstream Pipe Bridge
venue: Access to Hutt River Cycle Trail Eastern Hutt Road, Silverstream, Upper Hutt 5019, New Zealand
description:
NAWIC Wellington Site Visit: Whakawhirinaki – The Silverstream Pipe Bridge
Join NAWIC Wellington for a special site visit to one of the region’s most critical infrastructure projects – the Whakawhirinaki Pipe Bridge in Silverstream.
📍 Location: Whakawhirinaki Pipe Bridge Project Site, Silverstream, Upper Hutt
📅 Date: Wednesday 23 July
🕒 Time: 3:45 PM (approx 1hr duration).
👷‍♀️ PPE Required: Hardhat, hi-vis, steel-capped boots, safety glasses, long pants, and long sleeves.
(PPE spares available, so please let us know in your RSVP if you need to borrow any items.)
Kindly hosted by Brian Perry Civil, this behind-the-scenes look at the nearly completed pipe bridge will offer a rare opportunity to see innovative civil construction in action. The visit is strictly limited to 15 places, so get in quick!
Constructed on behalf of Greater Wellington and Wellington Water, the new pipe bridge replaces a seismically vulnerable section of bulk water pipeline that supplies all of Porirua City and North Wellington. The project involves 1000 metres of 1-metre diameter steel pipe across the Te Awa Kairangi / Hutt River and Manor Park golf course – including a striking new three-span pipe bridge with a 100m network arch at the central span.
Named Whakawhirinaki by local iwi during a dawn ceremony, the name reflects the trust and responsibility the bridge carries as it delivers essential water to thousands of people.
Through early contractor involvement and outside-the-box thinking, Brian Perry Civil and other project stakeholders have achieved significant cost savings and carbon reductions, showcasing innovation in both design and delivery.
🎟️ This event is free and open to NAWIC members only
🦺 Spaces are limited. RSVP now to secure your spot!
We look forward to seeing you onsite!
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.
Photo supplied: Brian Perry Civil

id: WELLINGTON - Governance Conference 2025-3 Pito-One Road, Korokoro, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: WELLINGTON - Governance Conference 2025
venue: 3 Pito-One Road, Korokoro, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
description:
Christian Savings is excited to be hosting our annual Governance Conference!
Christchurch on Wed, 27 Aug (location to be announced)
Auckland on Wed, 3 Sept (location to be announced)
Wellington on Wed, 10 Sept (location to be announced)
“If people can't see what God is doing, they stumble all over themselves; But when they attend to what he reveals, they are most blessed.” (Prov. 29:18 MSG)
This year the theme is "A Clear Vision for Confident Governance," reflecting the evolving landscape of the New Zealand Church. Our mission is to equip those serving in governance roles with practical governance skills, Gospel inspiration, and a humble understanding of the challenges that lie ahead.
Join us for a lineup of sessions that will tackle crucial issues facing the New Zealand Church and Charities, from leadership and succession planning to asset management and enhancing governance capabilities. Learn from interviews and interactive sessions led by esteemed keynote speakers and hosts, including Chris Clarke, Richard Black, Strahan Wallis, and Steven Moe.
As well as the opportunity to learn from leaders in this field, you will also be able to meet a diverse range of other people involved in Christian governance.
Ticket Info:
Day Session Only (9am-5pm)
Ticket includes sessions from our speakers, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea.
Evening Session Only (6pm-9pm)
Ticket includes dinner and an evening Masterclass.
Day & Evening (9am-9pm)
Ticket includes sessions from our speakers, morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea, and tea and coffee, dinner, and evening Masterclass.
Evening Masterclass:
We're thrilled to be hosting an enhanced evening Masterclass, a unique and interactive workshop tailored to give a demonstration of good governance in practice. Building on the success of last year's feedback, this session promises a fun and informative experience, especially for those unable to attend the day session. Immerse yourself in valuable insights in an intimate setting, complete with dinner included in your ticket for added convenience.

We look forward to welcoming leaders, trustees, directors, officers, and elders of churches and Christian charities dedicated to governing with excellence. Stay tuned for more updates as we approach the event date - we can't wait to welcome you!
SOME OF OUR GUEST SPEAKERS

Chris Clarke
Chris Clarke brings over 30 years of leadership experience, including 20 years as a CEO, across public policy, health care, humanitarian development, and philanthropy. Currently, he serves as CEO of the Wilberforce Foundation and chairs two boards: The Emergency Alliance, and Arrow Leadership Global. His past roles include CEO of World Vision New Zealand and Hawke’s Bay District Health Board, with additional experience at the World Health Organisation and NHS. A law and commerce graduate from Canterbury University, Chris has been the Praxis Visiting Scholar at Green Templeton College, Oxford University, since 2009.

Steven Moe

Steven Moe is a partner at Parry Field Lawyers with a focus on governance and legal structures for purpose driven groups including Churches and Charities. He has 24 years of experience as a lawyer and is on several boards including Christian Savings. He is also the Chair of Community Finance, which has raised more than $163 million for social housing. He is a member of the Charities Services sector group, the Edmund Hillary Fellowship, the XRB Advisory Panel and is a facilitator on governance for the Institute of Directors and hosts their podcast ‘Board Matters’ on governance. He also is the host of Seeds - a podcast with 395+ long-form conversations on governance, leadership and entrepreneurship. He is coordinating the Christian Lawyers Conference in September in Auckland for about 150 lawyers.



Richard Black
Richard is the founder and director of Thriving Churches HQ, an organisation empowering churches and church leaders to make a greater Kingdom difference. He has always had a heart for the growth and wellbeing of churches, their leaders, and their people.

An ordained minister, qualified counsellor, and experienced communicator, Richard has been involved in people work for over 25 years. He founded the counselling and wellbeing organisation, Mind Health, and holds a BA, Bachelor of Divinity, Bachelor of Theology (First Class Hons), Masters in Counselling (Distinction) and is a Member of the New Zealand Association of Counsellors. His research has explored key saboteurs undermining church leaders and strategic factors that enhance pastoral effectiveness and wellbeing.

Richard has developed three significant transformation courses for the church and leaders and is a regular voice on Radio Rhema. He is passionate about seeing churches fulfil their purpose in God. Richard is an excellent communicator with the knack of being able to communicate complex issues in a way that is practical and easy to understand.

He is the author of Centred: Knowing who you are in an off-balanced world and a children's book, There’s a Happy Moon in My Side. Richard is married to Jennifer, and they have three adult children.

Strahan Wallis

Strahan is one of New Zealand’s most experienced and recognised Public Relations leaders. With more than 25 years-experience he has led and delivered internationally awarded communications campaigns as well as orchestrating some the highest profile issues and crisis management responses for a range of clients around the world. Strahan was a Board Director and CEO of the Clemenger Group, New Zealand’s largest and most awarded marketing services company, up until March 2024 and is now an independent board director and consultant. He is currently senior counsel at WALLIS&CO and takes on a limited number of clients.

Raised on a farm in Raglan, he lives at Red Beach with his wife Racheal, their three children and Poppy, their wee Maltese-Shitsu.

He is a Fellow (nominated by peers) and an Accredited Member of the Public Relations Institute of New Zealand (PRINZ) and a Certified Member of the Institute of Directors (IOD).

id: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender-Hamilton-Humanitix
name: Take Up Space - HAMILTON - Any gender
venue: Hamilton
description:
Is self-doubt is making your life small?
Self-doubt is exhausting because you’re busy second guessing yourself the whole time. And while you do that, you’re missing out on the chance to say what you really mean and be who you really are.
Maybe some of these things sound familiar?
You don’t feel you’ve the right to pursue your dreams
You don’t have the confidence to speak up and share ideas
You’d love to dress differently but you’re scared what people will say.
You feel the ‘professional’ person you are at work isn’t the real you.
You’re doing what’s expected of you, but it feels like you’re leading someone else’s life.
No more. You only get one life. It’s time to take up space.

This workshop is for you
If lack of confidence is holding you back
If you’re struggling with leadership
If you’ve been told you’re too much

What we'll cover in the workshop
Build a foundation that’ll empower you to take risks, overcome fear and self-doubt, and do the things you’ve always wanted to do. Here’s some of the great stuff we’ll cover.
Trust yourself. Change the way you think and feel about yourself.
Deal with challenges. Become more resilient whatever life serves up.
Lead authentically. Become the sort of leader who helps others take up space too.
Go for your dreams. Learn how to go after what you want in life.
A fun day of laughter and connection for anyone who wants to explore how they can take up more space in the world. Be less apologetic and less self-conscious. Feel confident knowing you can stand comfortably anywhere you choose.
9:00am start
Lunch included
3:00pm finish & head for a drink
Everyone welcome. No more of this diminutive bullshit. Take. Up. Space.

Move past self-doubt into self-confidence
We’re running this workshop because we meet so many people hiding away, playing small, not standing in their full power.
And it breaks our heart that so many people can’t see how brilliant they are.
Partly that’s because in New Zealand it’s a bit dirty to be proud of yourself. We say fuck that. But often it’s more. Maybe people who should have backed you cut you down and you’ve internalised their BS ever since.
But that’s enough. It’s time to take up space.

Ticket price
$299 + booking fee
Everyone welcome. Lunch included.
Meet your irreverent badass hosts
Miraka (Shelly) Davies
Described as the lovechild of Brené Brown and P!nk, aged 37, Shelly walked away from her family’s five-generation commitment to conservative Christianity and started the exploratory period of her life, also known as “fucking shit up.” A people pleaser in recovery, she infiltrates organisations on the pretext of giving writing training and subverts teams to question the rules, while using her hard-won lessons in badassery to inspire you to know yourself, love yourself, find power, and have joy.
Belinda Thomas
The Veuve Cliquot of the professional development world, with a bag of Bluebird chips on the side, Belinda is expert in the neuroscience of success but gives few fucks about corporate bluster. Growing up on a Hawkes Bay sheep farm, she’s as comfortable sitting at a boardroom table as she is having tequila shots off the back of a ute at your local A&P show. venue: 42 Udy Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
description:
Join Big Brothers Big Sisters of Wellington and Guest Speaker Glen Denham on Friday 22 August at the Petone Club, Udy Street, Petone for a delicious buffet breakfast, exciting live auction, raffles and more!
Glen Denham is the Principal of Wellington College, where he channels his lifelong passion for teaching and school leadership. Raised in a single-parent home, Glen's experiences growing up shaped his resilience and drive to succeed. Throughout his distinguished career, he has accumulated a wealth of diverse experiences, each adding a unique dimension to his approach to education.
Before transitioning into teaching, Glen was a national basketball player, earning a spot as a Tall Black for 16 years during the 1980s and 1990s. As team captain for 13 of those years, he was regarded as one of New Zealand’s top players and a key figure in the country's basketball legacy. His journey from professional athlete to educator has shaped his dynamic leadership style, blending discipline, resilience, and teamwork with a deep commitment to nurturing youth.
All proceeds from this event stay in your community and support Big Brothers Big Sisters of Wellington so don’t forget to have your bids ready for the exciting live auction.
Doors open at 6.30 am, for a 7.00 am start.

id: Sacred Pulse - A Journey for Palestine Fundraiser-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Sacred Pulse - A Journey for Palestine Fundraiser
venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
description:
Join us for an Ecstatic Dance and Sound Journey to raise vital funds for Mahmoud Al-Madhoun and his family, who are from Northern Gaza.
Mahmoud shares four children with his wife, Nour. They have a baby girl named Omnia (age 1), and three sons, Team (3), Ahmed (7) and Faiz (11). Omnia and her mother, Nour, were evacuated from Gaza via ambulance during the last ceasefire, before hostilities resumed. Unfortunately, Mahmoud and Omnia’s three big brothers were denied evacuation. Thus, the boys remain in Gaza with Mahmoud, where things are painfully difficult. Like all Palestinians, they are struggling to survive and the hardships just keep intensifying.
Upon arrival in Cairo, Omnia had to wait weeks for open heart surgery, a life saving treatment that she required at birth. With Gaza under constant bombardment, Omnia was unable to have surgery once her parents learned of her condition shortly after her birth.
Mahmoud and Nour have lost everything, their house, their livelihoods, and have been forced to evacuate multiple times, all while managing the complexities that come with supporting a child with difficult medical needs. Their suffering has been further exacerbated because of them being separated, meaning Mahmoud was unable to support his daughter and wife during surgery. No parent ever should be forced to endure such dire and heartbreaking circumstances.
This event is a call for community, compassion, and action — every dollar raised will go directly to help Mahmoud provide basic necessities and rebuild a sense of safety and hope for his family.
Let’s come together in movement and music to support this family in their time of urgent need. Your presence and contribution can truly make a difference.
Meet the Team:

Kellie Smith— Sound Ceremonialist
Kellie is a sacred space holder and sound practitioner. She completed her Master’s degree in Criminology in 2012, specialising in genocide and international humanitarian law. She draws upon her professional background and experience in trauma support work, blending themes of collective consciousness and justice into her sound offerings.
She brings deep love and wisdom into every tone and vibration she channels. Her sound frequencies and crystal-clear presence invite you into a realm of deep remembering, restoration, and renewal through the power of sound.
Lisa Schady — Voice of the Sacred
Lisa Schady is a captivating performing artist known for curating transformative spaces using her powerful voice and intuitive mic presence. With deep reverence, she guides participants through emotional landscapes with safety and intention. If you’ve ever stepped into one of her temples, you’ll know—Lisa creates sacred containers where what’s alive within can rise and be felt.
Andrzej — Musical Mystic
Andrzej is a musician extraordinaire whose ecstatic dance sets are a journey in themselves. With a rich tapestry of tribal beats, global rhythms, and soul-stirring melodies, he’ll guide us up, in, through, and out—awakening the body, stirring the spirit, and inviting pure, embodied expression. His music opens portals to presence, joy, and freedom. Offering an expansive celebration of dance and movement in the name of peace.
Saxon Brazier holds a Diploma in Music and Event Management. Deeply moved and conflicted by the ongoing genocide in Gaza, she has spearheaded this kaupapa as a way to turn anguish into action—organizing efforts to raise funds and awareness in support of a family’s urgent journey to safety.

id: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington-100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington
venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Course: SPOPEU
Duration: 4 Days
Audience: End Users
Microsoft Course: 55215
Overview
This course delivers the complete site owner story from start to finish in an engaging and practical way to ensure you have the confidence to plan and create new sites or manage your existing sites, whether you're using SharePoint Online through Microsoft 365, or SharePoint 2019 on-premises. Your goal is to learn how to make SharePoint relevant to your team by using a sites functionality to help you share information and collaborate with your colleagues. During the class you will also learn best practices and ‘what not to do’ as you watch live, interactive demonstrations and put theory into practice with hands on exercises.
Module List
Module 1: Introduction to SharePoint
Module 2: Finding Content
Module 3: Working with Lists
Module 4: Working with Libraries
Module 5: Working with Publishing Features
Module 6: Leveraging Social Content in the Business
Module 7: Site Owner Responsibilities
Module 8: Creating and Managing Sites
Module 9: Site Customisation
Module 10: Permissions and Security
Module 11: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries
Module 12: Advanced Document Management
Module 13: Power Platform Integration
Module 14: Creating & Managing Content Types
